sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Find the rank of the following matrix:

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 1 & 0 \\
-1 & 3 & 2 \\
4 & 0 & -1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$
message_2:
To find the rank of the matrix, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to get the matrix in row-echelon form and then count the number of non-zero rows.

$$
\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 1 & 0 \\
-1 & 3 & 2 \\
4 & 0 & -1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
\rightarrow
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0.5 & 0 \\
0 & 2.5 & 2 \\
0 & -2 & -1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
\rightarrow
\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 0.5 & 0 \\
0 & 2.5 & 2 \\
0 & 0 & 1 \\
\end{bmatrix}
$$

The matrix is now in row-echelon form, and we can see that all rows are non-zero. Therefore, the rank of the matrix is 3.
